results.title: Terror in the aisles
results.creator_credit: Andrew J Kuehn, Stephen Netburn and Kaleidoscope Films
results.brief_description: With excerpts from over fifty films from the horror genre, “Terror in the aisles” delivers a fast paced montage of some of the most terrifying scenes in cinema from the best of the horror genre. This collection is not for the faint-hearted but will satisfy the horror buff as some of the most classic scenes from the genre are revisited here. Some excerpts include: “The Exorcist”, “Psycho”, “Carrie”, “Shining”, “Rosemary’s baby”, “The Howling”, “Eyes of Laura Mars”, “Midnight express”, “Halloween”, “The Birds”, “Suspiria”, “Marathon man”, “Jaws”, “The Texas chainsaw massacre”, “Poltergeist”, “The Fog”, “Scanners and many more. Narrated by Donald Pleasence and Nancy Allen.

results.title: The Verdict
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, David Brown, Richard Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A courtroom drama starring Paul Newman as Frank Galvin, an alcoholic Boston lawyer struggling to make a living. Approached to represent a comatose young woman in a medical negligence case, he uses the opportunity to redeem himself and resurrect his career. Initially willing to accept a settlement that will alleviate his financial situation and avoid a confrontation with a large law firm, he decides to go to trial and fight for justice. James Mason plays an unscrupulous lawyer, prepared to use any tactic to defend the doctor at the centre of the malpractice claim. Also Stars Charlotte Rampling and Jack Warden. Screenplay by David Mamet, based on the novel by Barry Reed.

results.title: Space cowboys
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Clipsal Films, Mad Chance, Malpaso Company and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: In the 1950s, a US test pilot team, codenamed Team Daedalus, have been training to become the first Americans in space. They are passed over by NASA who decide to send a chimp instead. Over the years, Frank Corvin (Clint Eastwood), Hawk Hawkins (Tommy Lee Jones), Jerry O’Neill (Donald Sutherland) and Tank Sullivan (James Garner) have been forgotten and move onto other professions - Corvin becomes an aerospace engineer, Hawkins, a freelance pilot, Sullivan, a Baptist minister, and O’Neill, an astrophysicist who designs roller coasters in his free time. The four all live a quiet life until NASA learns that a Russian satellite will crash into earth, causing a major communication blackout, unless a failure in the satellite’s system can be repaired. When NASA discovers that the satellite’s system is identical to one Corvin designed, they ask him for help. He agrees, but only if he can do the repairs himself and that the original Team Daedalus can come along as his crew. ‘Space cowboys’ was produced and directed by Clint Eastwood. Cast also includes James Cromwell, Marcia Gay Harden, Courtney B. Vance, Loren Dean and William Devane.

results.title: Rebecca [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, David O. Selznick and Selznick International Pictures
results.brief_description: Joan Fontaine plays a modest and shy young woman, who meets, falls in love with, and eventually marries Maxim de Winter (played by Lawrence Olivier), a widower on vacation. When the new Mrs de Winter arrives at Maxim’s mansion, Manderley, she finds a house of hostile servants, most notably the housekeeper who works with sinister cunning to keep alive the influence of her late mistress, Rebecca. Hitchcock’s only Academy Award for Best Picture. Based on the Daphne du Maurier novel.

results.title: The 39 Steps [DVD]
results.brief_description: Adapted from the novel of the same name by John Buchan. Using the style and technique that were to make him famous, Hitchcock gained immediate audience sympathy for the plight of his central character, an innocent Canadian, who while visiting England, is implicated in the theft of national secrets and murder. This fast paced, often humorous, spy/chase thriller pays homage to Buchan rather than being a close adaption of his novel and was later remade by Hitchcock as ‘North by North West’. The purpose of the chase - the MacGuffin as Hitchcock called it - becomes increasingly irrelevant except as the means of holding a series of vignettes together. Cast includes Robert Donat, Madeleine Carroll and Peggy Ashcroft.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Season one. Eps 1 and 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Duwayne Dunham, Gregg Fienberg, Frost Productions and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: EPISODE ONE: In this first instalment, FBI Agent Dale Cooper continues in his investigation of the death of Laura Palmer. An autopsy reveals a few unexpected clues relating to Laura’s actions on the night of her murder. Meanwhile, the first suspect, Laura’s secret lover James Hurley, is released from custody, while several other people are questioned regarding their relations with Laura. EPISODE TWO: Agent Cooper turns to unconventional criminology methods, lecturing the local Sheriff’s office on the wisdom of Tibet. Several important plot threads are also revealed in this episode, while a new and uneasy friendship forms between the sultry and spoilt Audrey Horne and Laura’s best friend, Donna Hayward. This episode, directed by Lynch himself, ends with the much discussed surreal dream sequence where Agent Cooper encounters strange figures such as the One-Armed Man, the Magician, the dancing Man from Another Place and Laura Palmer herself. Cast includes: Madchen Amick, Dana Ashbrook, Richard Beymer, Lara Flynn Boyle, Sherilyn Fenn, Warren Frost, Peggy Lipton, James Marshall, Everett McGill, Jack Nance, Ray Wise, Joan Chen, Piper Laurie, Eric Da Re, Harry Goaz, Michael Horse, Sheryl Lee, Russ Tamblyn, Grace Zabriskie, Miguel Ferrer, Walter Oklexicz, Royce D. Applegate and Kyle MacLachlan.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Lance Hool, Paul Hogan, Bungalow Films, Silver Lion Films and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: In the third instalment in the Crocodile Dundee series, Paul Hogan reprises the titular character of Mick Crocodile Dundee, only this time the principal action takes place in Los Angeles. Mick is living in Walkabout Creek with his wife Sue and son, when Sue is recalled to Los Angeles to take over her father’s newspaper. As there is an embargo on crocodile shooting, Mick decides it would be for the best if the entire family relocate to LA for a spell. Once in LA, Mick lands a role as an extra in a film, gets a job handling animals on set, goes about solving a murder mystery and uncovers some illegal dealings in the movie business. Mick is typically chaotic with his misunderstandings of the cultural nuances of LA, holding up a freeway in order to catch a skunk and foiling muggers with his bush skills. “Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles” is a fish out of water comedy that relies on reviving the successful jokes of its predecessors in the series. Like the other Crocodile Dundee films, this one panders to gross Australian stereotypes as a formula for comedy. With cameos from Mike Tyson and George Hamilton.

constellations_other.name: Designing across eras and genres
constellations_other.description: Acclaimed costume designer Marion Boyce created this beautiful black satin dress and eggshell cape worn by Sarah Snook in The Dressmaker. Her designs nabbed her an AACTA for best costume design, but over her decades-long career, she's proved herself a versatile artist.

results.title: Once upon a time in China (Restored version) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tsui Hark, Film Workshop and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The first of one of the classic Kung Fu films starring champion Jet Li as legendary martial arts folk hero, Wong Fei Hung. Set in a time when foreign traders and Jesuit priests were beginning to enter China, Wong Fei Hung leads the Black Army, a local militia determined to protect the town against the evil forces which operate in it. An action film which will amaze and astound as Jet Li performs a series of heroic feats, defeating any evil in his path. Restored widescreen version containing over 10 minutes of footage previously not included on video. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: An Ideal husband
results.creator_credit: Oliver Parker, Barnaby Thompson, Bruce Davey, Uri Fruchtmann, Fragile Films, ICON, Ideal Films (GB) and Pathé Frères
results.brief_description: Romantic comedy set in London during the late 1800’s inspired by Oscar Wilde’s play. Rupert Everett plays Arthur Goring, an upper class, womanising bachelor famed for his idleness and wit. His best friend Sir Robert Chiltern (Jeremy Northam) is a respected politician with a captivating and righteous wife (Cate Blanchett). Arthur’s loyalty and friendship is put to the test when the foundation of his friend’s idyllic marriage is threatened by the arrival of the scheming Mrs Cheveley (Julianne Moore) carrying secrets from Sir Robert’s past. Arthur finds himself caught up in a web of love, betrayal and deceit as he attempts to console his friends and protect their marriage. His actions inadvertently lead to changes in his own life and future. Also stars Minnie Driver and John Wood. Screenplay by Oliver Parker. Photography by David Johnson. Edited by Guy Bensley. Music composed by Charlie Mole.

results.title: Invasion of the body snatchers (1978)
results.creator_credit: Philip Kaufman, Robert H Solo and Solofilm Productions
results.brief_description: This remake of the 1956 classic takes place in the 1970s in San Francisco. Spores rain forth, unseen, from outer space, and soon strange flowers begin to bloom all over the city. One by one residents are suddenly losing thir individuality and becoming drone-like shadows of their former selves. As the phenomenon spreads, two Department of Health workers uncover the horrifying truth: that mysterious pods are cloning humans and destroying the originals. Cast includes: Donald Sutherland, Brooke Adams, Leonard Nimoy, Veronica Cartwright and Jeff Goldblum.
